DOCNAME: CASE OF TAYLAN AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant worked for a NORP company in GPE DATE . Following the termination of his contract by the company the applicant brought civil proceedings before the NORP courts and requested compensation . On DATE the NORP courts partially awarded the applicant 's claims . Upon his return to GPE the applicant brought the following proceedings before the NORP courts .

CARDINAL . Without specifying before which court , the applicant stated that he instituted domestic proceedings on DATE for the recognition of the NORP court order . According to the applicant , these proceedings had later been abrogated . The applicant did not present any document regarding these proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings before the ORG requesting the recognition of the NORP court order . On DATE the ORG rejected the applicant 's request . The applicant appealed and on DATE ORG quashed the decision on the ground that the first instance court did not have jurisdiction . On DATE ORG further rejected the rectification request . On DATE the ORG issued a decision of non - jurisdiction .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the proceedings to be referred to the competent labour court . On DATE the GPE ORG held that the case before it concerned the recognition of the NORP court order , the contents of which were the subject matter of the proceedings pending before ORG that the applicant had introduced separately on DATE . Therefore there was no need to continue the proceedings . The applicant appealed . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant initiated proceedings before ORG and requested compensation for the same period that had been examined and concluded by the NORP court as well as a number of other damages . After holding CARDINAL hearings ORG partially awarded the applicant on DATE . The applicant appealed . ORG upheld the judgment on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant also instituted proceedings before the GPE CARDINALth ORG against the NORP company and requested the payment of DATE salary . These proceedings which started on DATE ended on DATE when the court partially upheld the applicant 's request . The applicant appealed and ORG upheld the judgment on DATE . The sum awarded was paid to the applicant .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicants brought proceedings before ORG and requested additional compensation for their property that had been expropriated . Claiming that the additional compensation amount to be awarded by the court would not have met their actual loss , the applicants later stopped pursuing their case and on DATE the court decided not to continue the proceedings . On DATE the applicants initiated proceedings before ORG and requested determination of the value of the expropriated property and their damages due to the expropriation . The court issued a decision of non - jurisdiction on the ground that the proceedings should have been instituted before the competent administrative court . The applicants ' appeal was further dismissed by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . Consequently , the applicants instituted damage proceedings on DATE before ORG . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants ' claims . Referring to the previous proceedings before ORG which the applicants had stopped pursuing , the court declared that the ORG could not be held liable for the applicants ' omission in not following the judicial procedure in due time . The applicants ' appeal and rectification requests were rejected by ORG on DATE and DATE respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE criminal proceedings were initiated against the applicant and CARDINAL others who were allegedly involved in a bribery and forgery incident . On DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE ORG convicted the applicant as charged . ORG quashed these judgments on DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE . According to the information submitted by the applicant , the proceedings are still pending before domestic courts .
